title: Gor'kul
body:
Architecture

The Fortress has two distinct faces: the severe looking open face (the oldest part of the fortress), which was built for the primary purpose of defence, and the inwards facing side (built and rebuilt on top of existing structures), which offers a more atheistically pleasing architectural mixture that was built at various stages over the ages. The latter face is split in two, divided by a large ridge in the mountain, but joined by a number of bridges.

The Three Bridges

At the end of the mountain road leading up to the fortress lie three long bridges that span over deep ravines. Before each bridge is a manned gate. Any who wish to pass must announce their identity and reason for entry to each gate in turn. As one gate is opened, a Carry-Oll is sent to the next with a message containing the visitor's details to confirm their claims.
preface: The great fortress of Gor'kul was built in Gorjovak on a mountain ridge during The Age of Empires by Mant Tummo, the Holder of Wind of The First Men.
